title: Drawing, "Textile Design:  Menuett [Minuet]", designed 1920–21
medium: Brush and gouache, graphite on paper
inscribed: Inscribed in pen and black ink on mount, upper left corner: MENUETT; Inscribed in pen and black ink on mount, center left: VENUSGÄRTCHEN.  Inscribed in blue crayon, upper right corner: (can't see because of frame)
creditline: Museum purchase from Smithsonian Collections Acquisition and Decorative Arts Association Acquisition Funds
description: Small patterns of alternating fleurettes and curly cues and dots in yellow and blue on dark green background.

exhibitions.title: Glass of the Avant-Garde: From Vienna Secession to Bauhaus

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Textile Design:  Menuett [Minuet]", designed 1920–21.
designed 1920–21. Brush and gouache, graphite on paper. Museum purchase from Smithsonian Collections Acquisition and Decorative Arts Association Acquisition Funds. 1988-62-1140.
